fields.headline: Hacker
fields.bodyText: Shot of the day Jointly awarded to the Has Been and the (probably) Never Was - aka Nick Faldo and Colin Montgomerie - who both struck beautiful iron second shots at the 5th hole to set up eagles. Faldo's landed short of the green and rolled to three feet, while Montgomerie still had to sink a 30-foot putt for his eagle. Hat of the day The American Rocco Mediate's outsized floppy rain hat - accompanied by sun glasses. Does he know what country he's in? Number cruncher There were so many birdies over the first two days here, the scoreboard operators had to get the so-called "creative department" at the Open to make up dozens more little red plastic threes . Parent trouble Despite the fact he has played in 60 major championships, Jose Maria Olazabal's parents have never seen him play in any of them. Until this week, that is. Apparently the couple were not desperately keen to come, but the Spaniard cajoled them into making the trip to Muirfield with the words: "Well, you have to do it sometime." They shouldn't have - he missed the cut. Haggis, anyone? "I'm dying of hunger; they serve us things to eat that I would not give to my dog . . . " Miguel Angel Jimenez makes friends with the Scottish culinary establishment. And he looked happy enough when Hacker spotted him among the frozen peas in Safeways in North Berwick the other night . . . Pulled up Saddest news of the day:Jaidee Thongchai who, you will recall, led the driving distance table after the first round, withdrew yesterday with a bad back. Thongchai, a former soldier in the Thai army, usually sleeps on the floor when travelling, to avoid just such an occurrence. But on Wednesday night he lay down on the bed for a cat nap, and woke up 12 hours later. It was the soft mattress that caused the back spasm during Thursday's round, he claimed yesterday. Rough Ryder Continuing our series of current Ryder Cup players who cannot hit a barn door with a nine-iron . . . today's lucky nominee is Phillip Price, who at this rate is heading for the Jean Van de Velde memorial prize for least used player, after missing the cut yesterday with a final score of seven over par (149). The Americans must be quaking in their golf shoes.
